title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Dec. 31, 2025)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Restaurants Stay up to date on the best new restaurants, recent openings, and the biggest dining updates across Greater Boston's food scene.
Gato Exotico, which serves tacos and other Mexican dishes and cocktails, is the latest restaurant now open in Greater Boston.

Matt Tetrault, General Manager, Gato Exotico It’s a good time to be a Greater Boston diner, with exciting and diverse restaurant openings occurring all over the metro area as we look forward to a new year in 2026.

title: Dorchester school to exit state control, 2 others no longer ‘underperforming’
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Education DESE praised the progress of UP Academy Holland in Dorchester Dearborn STEM Academy in Roxbury and the Fonseca Elementary School in Fall River.
A view of a math class at Boston Dearborn STEM Academy in Roxbury.

(David L Ryan/The Boston Globe Staff) A previously underperforming Dorchester school will exit state receivership and two other schools will no longer be designated as “underperforming,” state education officials announced earlier this month.

title: Hundreds of flights delayed, canceled at Logan amid forceful winds
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Seventy flights, 65 through local airliner CapeAir, arriving and leaving Logan Airport were canceled.
FILE — Delta Air Lines jets on the tarmac at Boston Logan Airport in Boston in 2023.

Vanessa Leroy/The New York Times By Molly Farrar December 30, 2025 | 6:29 PM 1 minute to read As strong winds gust into Boston on Tuesday, hundreds of flights in and out of Logan Airport are facing delays and cancellations.
